intro: Ginalloa, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical climates. Ginalloa species often thrive in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making them suitable for gardens and landscapes. Their ornamental value is heightened by their vibrant blooms and unique foliage structure.
